abstract: Exhibit The Critique of Reason: Romantic Art, 1760-1860, illustrating engagement of artists of Romantic movement with science, politics and social issues of their time, is at Yale University Art Gallery; is first large-scale collaboration between the gallery and Yale Center for Public Art (Metropolitan/Connecticut).
lead_paragraph: A show at the Yale University Art Gallery aims to debunk the conventional view of Romanticism as a movement rooted in fantasy and solipsism, while rejecting the emphasis on knowledge and reason.

headline.main: ‘The Critique of Reason’ Redefines the Meaning of Romantic Art
headline.print_headline: Art Rooted in Matters of the Heart and the Mind
